title: FPS stands to 60 after Windows 10 update
body: Hallo summoners!i used to have 120-144 fps ,never less than 100 but before 1-2 months windows 10 made an update,i couldnt join league of legends cause my pc was crashing again and again,so i made my pc situation like it was before this update(never crashed again). My fps now is just 60,not less not more.i dont know,windows 10 sucks. i got Nvidia Geforce 840M,intel core i7-5500U CPU 2.40 GHZ and 8gb RAM,any solution?

replies.body: If you go into the Nvidia control panel and disable V-sync, Threaded Optimization, and Triple Buffering for League you will definitely see an improvement in FPS and stability.

There are a couple causes for this, and I think the windows update might be playing a part.  To start, disable the [Xbox Game Bar](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) which was auto-enabled and causing fps problems for some players.  

You might also have bad drivers or game files that's causing your fps to drop, so give our [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide a go for the fix.  Let me know if you have any questions!
